title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Jackpot Florist’s dominant strategy is to close at 6 p.m.
The response states that Jackpot Florist’s dominant strategy is to close at 6 p.m.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must use numbers from the payoff matrix in the explanation in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that this is not the profit-maximizing action by Boulevard and/or does not explain that Boulevard will earn $30 by choosing Delivery instead of $20 by choosing No Delivery.
The response states that this is not the profit-maximizing action by Boulevard and explains that Boulevard will earn $30 by choosing Delivery instead of $20 by choosing No Delivery.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the profit for Boulevard Gardens in the Nash equilibrium as $30.
The response identifies the profit for Boulevard Gardens in the Nash equilibrium as $30.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that they would choose to close at 9 p.m. and offer No Delivery.
The response states that they would choose to close at 9 p.m. and offer No Delivery.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does neither of the following

· Redraws the payoff matrix showing the effect of the agreement.

· States that Boulevard will agree to Jackpot’s proposal and explains that Boulevard will be better off because this will increase the payoff from $30 to $40.
The response does one of the following

The response does both of the following

· Redraws the payoff matrix showing the effect of the agreement.

· States that Boulevard will agree to Jackpot’s proposal and explains that Boulevard will be better off because this will increase the payoff from $30 to $40.
